page.title: 08Mattishall Anglican Churches
page.content: Mattishall Church stands proud at the centre of the township of Mattishall. It must have been the focal point for much of the life of the parish from Saxon times onwards. The two Mattishall churches provide an interesting contrast that is typical of many in East Anglia. Mattishall Burgh Church has,apart from the northern chapel,the simpler plan of the little modified thirteenth century church:it has no architectural evidence of having had Saxon or Norman phases in its construction.Mattishall Church is a fine example of that group of churches that was rebuilt in the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries. In the Domesday Book of 1086 there is only one church recorded in Mattishall.Whilst this does not disprove the existence of a second,it does prove that one existed then.
